attributes.action: launch an immediate inquiry into allegations that the security services and the then Prime Minister had concluded on the eve of the Iraq war that Saddam Hussein did NOT have weapons of mass destruction.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In his book The Way Of The World, published last year, the American investigative author Ron Suskind alleges that MI6 established secret contacts in January-February 2003 with Saddam's intelligence chief Tahir Jalil Habbush. According to Suskind, these convinced MI6 - and Tony Blair - that Saddam Hussein had no WMD. This story has not been directly denied. Its implications are profound. The British people - especially those who have suffered direct loss in the Iraq war - are entitled to know whether or not it is true. They should not have to wait for a general inquiry into the Iraq war, which may take years.
